svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
February 11, 2023" date: "2023-02-11"
Eth News and Links
Shapella (Shanghai + Capella) upgrade
* Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella on Tuesday February 28, 4:04:48 AM UTC , a sync
committee & historical roots boundary
Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella on Tuesday February 28, 4:04:48 AM UTC , a sync
* Zhejiang testnet upgraded to Shapella , processing full & partial withdrawals and BLS
changes Guide to run a Teku+Besu node
Zhejiang testnet upgraded to Shapella , processing full & partial withdrawals and BLS
changes
* Guide to run a Teku+Besu node
* Ephemery (ephemeral testnet) upgraded to Shapella
Ephemery (ephemeral testnet) upgraded to Shapella
* Latest all core devs - consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Ben Edgington &
Christine Kim : Sepolia testnet upgrade date selected, Goerli testnet could follow 1-2
weeks later (early/mid March) with mainnet a couple of weeks after that, assuming no
issues Fallback from MEV-Boost needs to be tested with Shapella Discussion of positive
EIP4844 block/blob decoupling simulation results Tim Beiko proposed using EIPs for
consensus layer & add core EIP editors Engine API exchange transition config to be
deprecated in Dencun upgrade
Latest all core devs - consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Ben Edgington &
Christine Kim :
* Sepolia testnet upgrade date selected, Goerli testnet could follow 1-2 weeks later
(early/mid March) with mainnet a couple of weeks after that, assuming no issues
Sepolia testnet upgrade date selected, Goerli testnet could follow 1-2 weeks later
* Fallback from MEV-Boost needs to be tested with Shapella
Fallback from MEV-Boost needs to be tested with Shapella
* Discussion of positive EIP4844 block/blob decoupling simulation results
Discussion of positive EIP4844 block/blob decoupling simulation results
* Tim Beiko proposed using EIPs for consensus layer & add core EIP editors
Tim Beiko proposed using EIPs for consensus layer & add core EIP editors
* Engine API exchange transition config to be deprecated in Dencun upgrade
Engine API exchange transition config to be deprecated in Dencun upgrade
* Danny Ryan’s Finalized update : Shapella upgrade & reminder of EF academic grants
round
Danny Ryan’s Finalized update : Shapella upgrade & reminder of EF academic grants round
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* KZG Ceremony: 39,000+ contributors , 2500+ in the lobby, 30 days left in first
general contribution period Dappnode adds support for contributing
KZG Ceremony:
* 39,000+ contributors , 2500+ in the lobby, 30 days left in first general contribution
period
39,000+ contributors , 2500+ in the lobby, 30 days left in first general contribution
* Dappnode adds support for contributing
Dappnode adds support for contributing
* Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence : planning to decouple
blobs from blocks
Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence : planning to decouple
Layer 1
* Lodestar added as fifth consensus layer client to mainnet staking launchpad
Lodestar added as fifth consensus layer client to mainnet staking launchpad
* Client team in person interop in Austria focused on Shapella & Dencun upgrades
Client team in person interop in Austria focused on Shapella & Dencun upgrades
* Lido MEV Boost relay list added Ultrasound, Agnostic & Aestus relays
Lido MEV Boost relay list added Ultrasound, Agnostic & Aestus relays
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.4.2 : peer scoring improvements & fix for isBetterUpdate
light client issue
Consensus layer:
* Lodestar v1.4.2 : peer scoring improvements & fix for isBetterUpdate light client
issue
* Execution layer: Erigon v2.38.0 : eth/68 support & fixes; v2.38.1 : patch
Execution layer:
* Erigon v2.38.0 : eth/68 support & fixes; v2.38.1 : patch
Research
* Metrics for network performance : value generated (welfare) & value gained by users
(surplus)
Metrics for network performance : value generated (welfare) & value gained by users
* Rollup relay to reduce trust assumptions in PBS relay
Rollup relay to reduce trust assumptions in PBS relay
Layer 2
* Kelvin Fichter: why 7 days is used for challenge period in Optimistic Rollups
Kelvin Fichter: why 7 days is used for challenge period in Optimistic Rollups
* Ticking-Optimism : ticking blockchain built on Optimism Bedrock, proof of concept
Ticking-Optimism : ticking blockchain built on Optimism Bedrock, proof of concept
* Optimism airdrop 2 : OP tokens sent directly to delegators and power users
Optimism airdrop 2 : OP tokens sent directly to delegators and power users
* Arbitrum Stylus announcement, programming environment & WASM VM for Arbitrum
One/Nova, allows for programs in non-EVM languages such as Rust, C, C++, expected in
Arbitrum Stylus announcement, programming environment & WASM VM for Arbitrum One/Nova,
allows for programs in non-EVM languages such as Rust, C, C++, expected in 2023
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP6465 : SSZ withdrawals root EIP6466 : SSZ transactions root EIP6475 : SSZ
Optional
EIPs:
* EIP6465 : SSZ withdrawals root
EIP6465 : SSZ withdrawals root
* EIP6466 : SSZ transactions root
EIP6466 : SSZ transactions root
* EIP6475 : SSZ Optional
EIP6475 : SSZ Optional
* ERCs: ERC6454 : Minimalistic non-transferrable NFTs ERC6464 : Multi-operator
per-token ERC721 approvals ERC6492 : Signature validation for predeploy contracts
[Resurrected] ERC223 : Fungible token with communication model
ERCs:
* ERC6454 : Minimalistic non-transferrable NFTs
ERC6454 : Minimalistic non-transferrable NFTs
* ERC6464 : Multi-operator per-token ERC721 approvals
ERC6464 : Multi-operator per-token ERC721 approvals
* ERC6492 : Signature validation for predeploy contracts
ERC6492 : Signature validation for predeploy contracts
* [Resurrected] ERC223 : Fungible token with communication model
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Nexus Mutual
Nexus Mutual is the leading insurance alternative for crypto and more. Over $10m in
claims paid across eight loss events including FTX and Hodlnaut.
Get covered against smart contract, slashing, and other risks.
Stuff for developers
* Remix IDE v0.30.0 : Solidity unit testing displays revert reason, ERC20 template
expands Solidity unit test examples, view compiler input, added Mocha Chai test &
Slither GitHub workflows and added Flatten & generate UML as internal plugins
Remix IDE v0.30.0 : Solidity unit testing displays revert reason, ERC20 template
* Foundry: Foundry Book: guide to invariant testing Visualize code coverage in Foundry
tests using coverage gutters Fuzzing ordered Solidity arrays in Foundry
Foundry:
* Foundry Book: guide to invariant testing
Foundry Book: guide to invariant testing
* Visualize code coverage in Foundry tests using coverage gutters
Visualize code coverage in Foundry tests using coverage gutters
* Fuzzing ordered Solidity arrays in Foundry
Fuzzing ordered Solidity arrays in Foundry
* Hardhat v2.12.7 : Hardhat Network option for blocks with same timestamp, http_proxy
environment variable support, batch requests via WebSocket and config validation for
optimizer runs
Hardhat v2.12.7 : Hardhat Network option for blocks with same timestamp, http_proxy
* Solidity compiler bloating deployments by including library functions only called in
the constructor in runtime bytecode
Solidity compiler bloating deployments by including library functions only called in
* PRBMath v3.3.0 : adds Rust like type casting
PRBMath v3.3.0 : adds Rust like type casting
* Epoch commit/reveal for NFT randomness
Epoch commit/reveal for NFT randomness
* ERC20Emit : ERC20 logic implemented in events, don’t use in production, beware of
Solidity's evaluation order of event parameters
ERC20Emit : ERC20 logic implemented in events, don’t use in production, beware of
* File pattern : single Solidity function that dispatches multiple setters
File pattern : single Solidity function that dispatches multiple setters
* Storage Struct pattern for storage in upgradeable contracts
Storage Struct pattern for storage in upgradeable contracts
* Query Storage Slot : web UI to read ERC1967 & custom proxy storage slots
Query Storage Slot : web UI to read ERC1967 & custom proxy storage slots
* Mr Steal Yo Crypto CTF solutions in Foundry
Mr Steal Yo Crypto CTF solutions in Foundry
* EVM puzzle solution using Halmos symbolic testing
EVM puzzle solution using Halmos symbolic testing
* Slither Printers to display/output contract info such as function summary &
inheritance
Slither Printers to display/output contract info such as function summary & inheritance
* Palla’s intro to coding zk proofs : overview of Circom, Halo2 & Noir using
rock/paper/scissors
Palla’s intro to coding zk proofs : overview of Circom, Halo2 & Noir using
* Semaphore v3 : CLI to create projects, Hardhat plugin to deploy Semaphore contract &
boilerplate demo
Semaphore v3 : CLI to create projects, Hardhat plugin to deploy Semaphore contract &
Security
* dForce on Arbitrum & Optimism ~$3.65M exploit via read only reentrancy of Curve pool
dForce on Arbitrum & Optimism ~$3.65M exploit via read only reentrancy of Curve pool
* Sperax USDs rebasing token on Arbitrum ~$300k exploit via internal balance bug, funds
returned after exploiter identified
Sperax USDs rebasing token on Arbitrum ~$300k exploit via internal balance bug, funds
* Barter solver on CoW Swap ~$166k exploit via arbitrary execution code
Barter solver on CoW Swap ~$166k exploit via arbitrary execution code
Ecosystem
* Ethereum.org page on staking withdrawals
Ethereum.org page on staking withdrawals
* Modeling withdrawals : extreme case of 110k ETH partial withdrawals on day 1 and
57.6k ETH full withdrawals per day
Modeling withdrawals : extreme case of 110k ETH partial withdrawals on day 1 and 57.6k
ETH full withdrawals per day
* EthStaker staking survey results : technical setup is barrier to solo staking
EthStaker staking survey results : technical setup is barrier to solo staking
* Proposal for Lido v2 : withdrawals & Staking Router to allow permissionless
onboarding of node operators
Proposal for Lido v2 : withdrawals & Staking Router to allow permissionless onboarding
of node operators
Enterprise
* Shopify tools for tokengating merchant apps, includes Shopify connect wallet (built
on wagmi React hooks)
Application layer
* Flux Finance (tokenized US treasury bonds) live on mainnet, currently earning ~4.3%
with $100k minimum and KYC required
Flux Finance (tokenized US treasury bonds) live on mainnet, currently earning ~4.3%
* Backed bCSPX : tokenized tracker for S&P UCITS ETF, non-US qualified investors only
Backed bCSPX : tokenized tracker for S&P UCITS ETF, non-US qualified investors only
* Nexus Mutual v2 partial claims are live on mainnet, being used for FTX, BlockFi &
Gemini claims
Nexus Mutual v2 partial claims are live on mainnet, being used for FTX, BlockFi &
* Aave’s GHO stablecoin live on Goerli testnet
Aave’s GHO stablecoin live on Goerli testnet
* Spark Protocol to use Element Finance’s Hyperdrive AMM for fixed rate lending on
Maker, competing with Aave
Spark Protocol to use Element Finance’s Hyperdrive AMM for fixed rate lending on Maker,
competing with Aave
* Synthetix adds 22 perpetual futures markets, mostly crypto plus a few major FOREX
markets
Synthetix adds 22 perpetual futures markets, mostly crypto plus a few major FOREX
* tBTC v2 (more “trustless” BTC) live via optimistic minting
tBTC v2 (more “trustless” BTC) live via optimistic minting
* Sound curator rewards : 5% on music NFT mints via referral links
Sound curator rewards : 5% on music NFT mints via referral links
* 53% of DAO delegates have never voted
53% of DAO delegates have never voted
Job Listings
* Request Network is hiring a Community & Communication Manager
Request Network is hiring a Community & Communication Manager
* Shell Protocol team is hiring senior Solidity devs & more , remote or Hawaii
Shell Protocol team is hiring senior Solidity devs & more , remote or Hawaii
* Community Lead for ethereum.org sought by Ethereum Foundation
Community Lead for ethereum.org sought by Ethereum Foundation
* Cyfrin.io is hiring senior security engineers $190k-$300k.
Cyfrin.io is hiring senior security engineers $190k-$300k.
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to
abcoathup.eth on mainnet or Layer 2. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC shuts Kraken’s staking as a service in US: SEC settlement for unregistered offer
& sale of securities includes $30 million payment Commissioner Peirce dissents:
paternalistic and lazy regulator ETH to be unstaked after Shapella upgrade
SEC shuts Kraken’s staking as a service in US:
* SEC settlement for unregistered offer & sale of securities includes $30 million
payment
SEC settlement for unregistered offer & sale of securities includes $30 million payment
* Commissioner Peirce dissents: paternalistic and lazy regulator
Commissioner Peirce dissents: paternalistic and lazy regulator
* ETH to be unstaked after Shapella upgrade
ETH to be unstaked after Shapella upgrade
* Paul Grewal: Coinbase’s staking services are not securities
Paul Grewal: Coinbase’s staking services are not securities
* Revolut (challenger bank) offers ETH staking in UK and parts of Europe
Revolut (challenger bank) offers ETH staking in UK and parts of Europe
* Bank of England digital pound (retail CDBC) consultation, may not use smart contracts
[PDF], feedback by June 7
Bank of England digital pound (retail CDBC) consultation, may not use smart contracts
* Nic Carter: US government is using banking sector to crackdown against crypto
Nic Carter: US government is using banking sector to crackdown against crypto
* Hermès won trademark lawsuit against NFTs depicting Hermès handbag
Hermès won trademark lawsuit against NFTs depicting Hermès handbag
General/crypto
* Erigon to remove code for BSC & Polygon unless they fund support & maintenance
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-february-11-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Feb 24 - Mar 1 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek
Feb 24 - Mar 1 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek
* Feb 27 – deadline for EF academic grants round
Feb 27 – deadline for EF academic grants round
* Feb 28 – Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella
Feb 28 – Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella
* Mar 2-5 – ETHDenver Hackathon
Mar 2-5 – ETHDenver Hackathon
* Mar 10-29 – Scaling Ethereum (ETHGlobal) virtual
Mar 10-29 – Scaling Ethereum (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Mar 15-16 – ETHDubai
Mar 15-16 – ETHDubai
* Mar 16-18 – ETH Porto
Mar 16-18 – ETH Porto
* Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio
Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio
* Apr 12-14 – NFT NYC
Apr 12-14 – NFT NYC
* Apr 14-16 – ETHGlobal Tokyo
Apr 14-16 – ETHGlobal Tokyo
* Apr 14-16 – ETHZurich conference & hackathon
Apr 14-16 – ETHZurich conference & hackathon
* Apr 21-25 – EthTaipei hackathon & conference
Apr 21-25 – EthTaipei hackathon & conference
* Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon
Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon
* May 5-7 – ETHMalaysia conference & hackathon
May 5-7 – ETHMalaysia conference & hackathon
* May 5-7 – ETHTallinn hackathon
May 5-7 – ETHTallinn hackathon
* May 9-10 – NFT Tallinn conference
May 9-10 – NFT Tallinn conference
* May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
* May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
* May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
* May 26–28 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
May 26–28 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
* Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
* Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Toronto
Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Toronto
* Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
* Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
* Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
* Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
* Oct 6–25 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
Oct 6–25 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
